block.p: Erica Melanie Brickman and Jeremy Scott Stynes were married last evening at the Westward Look Resort in Tucson. Rabbi Shafir Lobb officiated.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Emory, where they met.
Erica Melanie Brickman and Jeremy Scott Stynes were married last evening at the Westward Look Resort in Tucson. Rabbi Shafir Lobb officiated.
Erica Melanie Brickman and Jeremy Scott Stynes were married last evening at the Westward Look Resort in Tucson. Rabbi Shafir Lobb officiated.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Emory, where they met.

Mrs. Stynes, 31, is a research associate in Palisades, N.Y., at the Center for International Earth Science Information Network, part of Columbia University. She is also a doctoral candidate in medical geography at University College London. She received a master's in public health from the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine.

The bride is the daughter of Rochelle Brickman and Dr. Fred Brickman of Tucson. The bride's father, a radiologist, is the owner of X-Ray Ltd. there. Her mother is an occupational therapist in the Tucson and Tanque Verde public schools.

Mr. Stynes, 32, works in New York at ARTstor, a nonprofit online library of visual art for scholars, teachers and students, developing ways to use the Web site. He received a master's degree in education technology from Harvard.

The bridegroom's mother, Bobbie Stynes of Charlotte, N.C., is a holistic health practitioner there. His father, Frank Stynes of Long Beach, Calif., is the senior vice president for ingredients at Ventura Foods, a maker of cooking oils, sauces and soups in Brea, Calif.
